```{r}
#1.
#a
data = data.frame(
respondents = c(1:20),
sex = c(2, 2, 1, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 1, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 1, 2),
fathers_occupation = c(1, 3, 3, 3, 1, 2, 3, 1, 1, 1, 3, 2, 1, 3, 3, 1, 3, 1, 2, 1),
persons_at_home = c(5, 3, 3, 6, 1, 9, 6, 7, 4, 1, 7, 5, 5, 7, 5, 8, 3, 6, 7, 6),
siblings_at_school = c(6, 4, 3, 5, 2, 1, 3, 3, 1, 2, 1, 3, 3, 5, 2, 2, 2, 5, 3, 3),
types_of_houses = c(1, 2, 3, 1, 1, 3, 1, 1, 2, 3, 3, 2, 3, 2, 2, 3, 2, 3, 3, 2))
print(data)
```
```{r}
#b
#The dataset contains information from 20 respondents, mostly female. Most fathers work in "other" occupations and close 2nd are farmers, while a smaller number are drivers. Households have an average of 5 members, with around 3 siblings attending school. Most respondents live in concrete or semi-concrete houses, suggesting relatively stable living conditions.
str(data)
```
